title: Which fountain pen brand is the best, Mont Blanc, Visconti, Sailor, or Aurora? - Quora

response.answer_text: A2a, thanks Matt.  Montblanc is best for showing off,  Visconti for design and innovation,  Aurora for understated practicability,  Sailor for workmanship and writing. From a personal perspective of collecting and writing, using very little pressure, I've made the following shortlist. Best major German brands: Pelikan, Diplomat, Lamy, Montblanc. Best major originally US brands: Sheaffer, Waterman, Parker. Best major Iltalian brands: Stipula, Delta, Montegrappa, Visconti. Best major Japanese brands: Sailor, Pilot, Platinum. I admire Visconti enormously for having built its brand in less than 30 years to where it is now. Beautiful pens in magnificent colors and materials, innovative ink filling systems. Still, nothing compares to the beauty of a Stipula Etruria. Preferably the 991. That's a limited edition in celluloid. But there are many regular Etruria's or more recent limited editions that share the same design and in all respects but material, are just as fine.  About half my little Etruria collection with four 991 I have many hundreds of fountain pens. With any of these brands and many more smaller brands you can have a magnificent writer straight out of the box. On the other hand, all sell also pens that will give you trouble. Due to the quality control of Sailor, the risk that you buy one that doesn't write well straight out of the box is significantly below average. Sailor also makes great nibs. If you buy your pen from a penshop where an expert can adjust nibs and feeds to your liking, your choice is virtually unlimited. Even pens as cheap as a few dollars can be made to provide you with years and years of writing pleasure.

Got to understand this from the outset…there have been literal physical confrontations over this question. Emotions can run quite high when the word “best” is with regards to ANY subjectively evaluated item. So, with that disclaimer— Of the four mentioned in the question, I’d rank them Visconti, Sailor, and Aurora a distant third. Mont Blanc doesn’t even register on my pen scale. Advertising gimmicks are rarely worth serious considering—IMHO and YMMV regarding the German wannabe. NOW—as Julianne pointed out, there is a whole passel of other marques that are solid “best contenders”. And know well each person answering your question is gonna have a “best list”. My list? Top Rung Visconti-Parker 51Conklin Crescent FillerNakimi Vanishing PointCertain classic EsterbrooksPelikan-I tend to the 2xx models and have a 3xx, all are goodWaterman CareneSecond Rung Sheaffer-specifically PFM, Intrigue, Valor and certain SnorkelsParker Duofold-both Vintage and ModernParker Vacu-matic-VintageLamy—any modelBexley-any modelCross Verve and MatrixThird Rung—Really so many models of marques already listed, these are just examples: Parker 21, VectorWaterman C/FAny Sheaffer with an inlaid nibMonteverdi TOOL pen-FP configurationCertain Jinhao, Wing Sung and Hero modelsKaras KustomWith about 400+ pens, I got all sorts of marques and types. Some good, some not so good. They are all in rotation at some point. I got my favorites. BEST—sorta like pizza-no such thing, really as a BAD pizza, some are just one heckava lot better than others.
